description: From Bryophyta, from Ancient Greek βρύον (brúon, “moss”) + φυτόν (phutón, “plant”) ( +‎ -phyte).

entries.meaning: (botany) Any plant of the division Bryophyta, defined sensu lato to comprise the mosses, liverworts and hornworts and corresponding to all embryophytes that are not vascular plants.
examples: Because of their small size and often delicate structure, bryophytes have a poor fossil record, dating back only about 290 million years.
